newsitem.title: USA: Intelligent Decision sets merger pact.
newsitem.headline: Intelligent Decision sets merger pact.

text.p: Intelligent Decision Systems Inc and National Purchasing Corp of Irvine, Calif., said they signed a letter of intent to merge in a transaction that could be valued at more than $30 million.
Under terms announced Wednesday, management of National Purchasing, which does business as HPSI, will succeed IDSI management after the deal is completed.
IDSI expects to finance the merger with a common stock offering or by issuing convertible preferred stock to institutional investors. The size will be determined after negotiations are concluded.
HPSI operates as a group purchasing organization servicing more than 6,000 locations, the majority of which are in the health care industry.
IDSI, through subsidiaries Digital Sciences Inc and Neptune Technology Leasing Corp provides computer software, hardware and systems leasing.
The company announced in October it hired consultants to identify strategic alliances and partners.
